components.description:
A telescope, as used to gaze at stars and planets in the night sky. Shown with an optical tube mounted on a tripod, positioned at various angles and generally depicted as metal.

Commonly used for various content concerning astronomy, outer space, celestial objects, and science more generally. May also be used for various concepts of sight (e.g., spying, viewing).

Twitter’s designs feature red hardware, as did as an older Google design.

title: Telescope

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Tool symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A telescope,Â used to view closer detail of stars and other objects in the night sky. Telescope was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 a http://emojipedia.org/telescope/
emoji_net_data.name: telescope

bn:00069738n: A monocular optical instrument possessing magnification for observing distant objects, especially in astronomy.
A telescope is an instrument that aids in the observation of remote objects by collecting electromagnetic radiation.
A magnifier of images of distant objects
An optical instrument for observing distant objects.
Instrument that aids in the observation of remote objects
